text: The Baojun 630 is a small family car made by SAIC-GM-Wuling under Baojun from 2011 to 2019. == History and Features == The Baojun 630 was developed at the SAIC-GM Pan Asia Technical Automotive Center and was shown at the Auto Shanghai in 2011 and was put on sale in August. The car is the first car from Baojun brand. It said that it uses the Buick Excelle/Daewoo Lacetti plataform even though the cars are visually different. A Hatchback version called 610 was launched in 2014. The 630 has a 1.5 liter and 1.8 liter petrol engines with a 5-speed manual transmission and a 6-speed automatic transmission. It was improved in 2015. == Markets == The Baojun 630 was sold mainly in China but in 2014 it was launched in Egypt and Algeria as the Chevrolet Optra and the Optra was sold in these two countries until 2023. == Discontinuation == The production of The 630 ended in 2019 in China. It was replaced by the Baojun RC-5 while in 2023 in Egypt it was replaced by the Chevrolet Aveo (which is a Chinese-platform car also made by SAIC-GM-Wuling and sold mainly in Mexico and Some South American countries). The Aveo in Egypt also uses the Optra name. == References == Category:Chinese automobiles Category:2010s automobiles Category:Sedans
title: Baojun 630
